required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Safety and Immunogenicity of Vi-CRM197 Vaccine Against S. Typhi in Children, Older Infants and Infants
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase 2, Randomized, Controlled, Observer Blind, Single Center Study of the Safety, Reactogenicity and Immunogenicity of the NVGH Glycoconjugate Vaccine Against S. Typhi in Children, Older Infants and Infants

brief_summary.textblock: This phase 2 trial is aimed to obtain information on the safety and immunogenicity of the Vi-CRM197 in children and infants from various age groups in the Philippines where Typhoid Fever is highly endemic and an efficacious vaccine against this disease is very much needed.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Subjects With at Least 4-fold Increase in Anti-Vi Enzyme-linked Immunosorbent Assay (ELISA) Titer
primary_outcome.time_frame: At 28 days after last vaccination as compared to baseline

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Subjects With at Least 4-fold Increase in Anti-Vi ELISA Titer
primary_outcome.time_frame: At 6 months after last vaccination as compared to baseline

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Any Solicited Local and Systemic Reaction, After Any Vaccination
secondary_outcome.time_frame: During the 7-day follow-up period after vaccination
secondary_outcome.description: Solicited local reactions were: erythema, induration, pain/tenderness. Solicited systemic reactions were; lethargy, irritability, vomiting, diarrhoea, loss of appetite (and persistent crying in the older infants and infants age group)

arm_group.description: Older Infants (9 to 12 months) receiving 2 doses of NVGH Vi-CRM197 vaccine
Older infants (9 to 12 months) receiving 2 doses of Pneumococcal conjugate vaccine
Infants (6 to 8 weeks) receiving 3 doses of NVGH Vi-CRM197 vaccine
Infants (6 to 8 weeks) receiving 3 doses of Pneumococcal conjugate vaccine
Children (24 to 59 months) receiving 2 doses of NVGH Vi-CRM197 vaccine
Children (24 to 59 months) receiving 1 dose of licensed Vi Polysaccharide vaccine and 1 dose of Pneumococcal conjugate vaccine

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion criteria:
- Subjects belonging to 3 age groups will be enrolled into the trial: children (24 to 59 months of age at enrollment), older infants (9 to 12 months of age at enrollment) and infants (6 weeks of age at enrolment).
- Written informed consent will be obtained by the parents/ guardians before enrollment into the trial.
- Infants who have been vaccinated with BCG and HBV at birth and OPV at any time since birth can be enrolled into the trial, while infants who have received DTwP+HBV+Hib due at 6 weeks of age as per local EPI schedule cannot be enrolled into the trial.

results_reference.citation: Bhutta ZA, Capeding MR, Bavdekar A, Marchetti E, Ariff S, Soofi SB, Anemona A, Habib MA, Alberto E, Juvekar S, Khan RM, Marhaba R, Ali N, Malubay N, Kawade A, Saul A, Martin LB, Podda A. Immunogenicity and safety of the Vi-CRM197 conjugate vaccine against typhoid fever in adults, children, and infants in south and southeast Asia: results from two randomised, observer-blind, age de-escalation, phase 2 trials. Lancet Infect Dis. 2014 Feb;14(2):119-29. doi: 10.1016/S1473-3099(13)70241-X. Epub 2013 Nov 28.

outcome.title: Percentage of Subjects With at Least 4-fold Increase in Anti-Vi Enzyme-linked Immunosorbent Assay (ELISA) Titer
outcome.time_frame: At 28 days after last vaccination as compared to baseline
outcome.population: Intention-to-treat analysis set, which included all participants who received the vaccination, those in whom at least one post-vaccination blood sample was collected, and those for whom at least one ELISA result was available.

reported_events.time_frame: Solicited Adverse Events (AEs) were collected during 7-day follow period after each vaccination. Serious AEs were collected throughout the study period. Unsolicited AEs were collected collected during 28-day follow period after each vaccination.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: In the event that no publication of the Study results has been made by NVGH within twelve (12) months of Study database lock and no proposed publication is under discussion by the publication committee, Principal Investigator may publish its own Study results.
